perturbation.original_text: HDI shall design, develop, implement, operate, maintain and manage, and enable the Company to establish a presence on the World Wide Web ("Site") to make available to Internet users on demand, men's and women's apparel and accessories from the Deerskin Catalog ("Deerskin Products").
perturbation.changed_text: HDI shall endeavor to design, develop, implement, operate, maintain and manage, and enable the Company to establish a presence on the World Wide Web ("Site") to make available to Internet users, apparel and accessories from the Deerskin Catalog ("Deerskin Products").
perturbation.explanation: The original text used definitive terms like 'shall,' creating a clear obligation. The modified text uses 'endeavor,' which is weaker and implies an attempt rather than a guaranteed result. This ambiguity contradicts consumer protection laws, which often require businesses to fulfill promised services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws (e.g., Federal Trade Commission Act)

perturbation.original_text: HDI shall have the Site fully operational and accessible on demand by users of the Internet no later than sixty (60) days from the date this Agreement has been executed by both Parties. In the event that HDI fails to have the Site fully operational within seventy (70) days from the date of this Agreement, the Company shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without penalty.
perturbation.changed_text: HDI will aim to have the Site operational and accessible to users of the Internet within a reasonable timeframe, with best efforts made to achieve this within sixty (60) days from the execution of this Agreement. If the Site is not operational within seventy (70) days, the Company may consider its options.
perturbation.explanation: This modification replaces the definite 'shall' with weaker terms like 'will aim' and 'reasonable timeframe,' creating uncertainty about HDI's obligation. The consequence of failure is also weakened from a guaranteed right to terminate to a vague 'may consider its options.' This contradicts contract law principles of clear and definite terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Principle of Definite Terms

perturbation.original_text: HDI agrees that it shall promote the Site and Deerskin Products no less favorably than it promotes HDI's catalog titles.
perturbation.changed_text: HDI agrees that it should consider promoting the Site and Deerskin Products in a manner somewhat similar to how it promotes HDI's catalog titles.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires HDI to promote the Site 'no less favorably' than its own catalogs. The modified text weakens this obligation significantly by replacing 'shall promote' with 'should consider promoting' and 'no less favorably' with 'in a manner somewhat similar.' This introduces ambiguity about the level of promotion required, contradicting the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing in contracts under New York law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing (New York law)
